Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\data\Pagination

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\data\Pagination » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
Pagination represents information relevant to pagination of data items.

When data needs to be rendered in multiple pages, Pagination can be used to represent information such as total item count, page size, current page, etc. These information can be passed to \yii\data\yii\widgets\Pager to render pagination buttons or links.

The following example shows how to create a pagination object and feed it to a pager.

Controller action:

function actionIndex()
{
    $query = Article::find()->where(['status' => 1]);
    $countQuery = clone $query;
    $pages = new Pagination(['totalCount' => $countQuery->count()]);
    $models = $query->offset($pages->offset)
        ->limit($pages->limit)
        ->all();

    return $this->render('index', [
         'models' => $models,
         'pages' => $pages,
    ]);
}

View:

foreach ($models as $model) {
    // display $model here
}

// display pagination
echo LinkPager::widget([
    'pagination' => $pages,
]);

Property Details

$pageVar property
string $pageVar = 'page'

Name of the parameter storing the current page index. Defaults to 'page'.

See Also

  • $params
$forcePageVar property
boolean $forcePageVar = true

Whether to always have the page parameter in the URL created by createUrl(). If false and $page is 0, the page parameter will not be put in the URL.

$route property
string $route = null

The route of the controller action for displaying the paged contents. If not set, it means using the currently requested route.

$params property
array $params = null

Parameters (name => value) that should be used to obtain the current page number and to create new pagination URLs. If not set, all parameters from $_GET will be used instead. In order to add hash to all links use array_merge($_GET, ['#' => 'my-hash']). The array element indexed by $pageVar is considered to be the current page number. If the element does not exist, the current page number is considered 0.

$urlManager property
yii\web\UrlManager $urlManager = null

The URL manager used for creating pagination URLs. If not set, the "urlManager" application component will be used.

$validatePage property
boolean $validatePage = true

Whether to check if $page is within valid range. When this property is true, the value of $page will always be between 0 and ($pageCount-1). Because $pageCount relies on the correct value of $totalCount which may not be available in some cases (e.g. MongoDB), you may want to set this property to be false to disable the page number validation. By doing so, $page will return the value indexed by $pageVar in $params.

$pageSize property
integer $pageSize = 20

Number of items on each page. Defaults to 20. If it is less than 1, it means the page size is infinite, and thus a single page contains all items.

$totalCount property
integer $totalCount = 0

Total number of items.

$pageCount property read-only
integer getPageCount( )

number of pages

$page property
integer getPage( $recalculate = false )
void setPage( $value )

the zero-based current page number.

$offset property read-only
integer getOffset( )

the offset of the data. This may be used to set the OFFSET value for a SQL statement for fetching the current page of data.

$limit property read-only
integer getLimit( )

the limit of the data. This may be used to set the LIMIT value for a SQL statement for fetching the current page of data. Note that if the page size is infinite, a value -1 will be returned.

Method Details

getPageCount() method
integer getPageCount( )
return integer number of pages

getPage() method
integer getPage( $recalculate = false )
$recalculate boolean Whether to recalculate the current page based on the page size and item count.
return integer the zero-based current page number.

Returns the zero-based current page number.

setPage() method
void setPage( $value )
$value integer The zero-based index of the current page.

Sets the current page number.

createUrl() method
string createUrl( $page, $absolute = false )
$page integer The zero-based page number that the URL should point to.
$absolute boolean Whether to create an absolute URL. Defaults to false.
return string the created URL

Creates the URL suitable for pagination with the specified page number.

This method is mainly called by pagers when creating URLs used to perform pagination.

See Also

  • $params
  • $forcePageVar
getOffset() method
integer getOffset( )
return integer the offset of the data. This may be used to set the OFFSET value for a SQL statement for fetching the current page of data.

getLimit() method
integer getLimit( )
return integer the limit of the data. This may be used to set the LIMIT value for a SQL statement for fetching the current page of data. Note that if the page size is infinite, a value -1 will be returned.
